page.title: 08BUILDINGS
page.content: In the area there are many old buildings,such as Stokeinteignhead school which is over 100 years old.The House of Prawns, a local restaurant, used to be three separate cottages. There are three pubs in the area, the Church House Inn, the Wild Goose and Combe Cellars. All are very old buildings. Near the school is the Old Forge and also the Old Chapel. Both are now private homes.Close by is Random Cottage where coffins used to be made. Opposite the Church House Inn is the Old Bakery which is now a cafe. Many barns have been converted into flats or houses. In Combeinteignhead there is one building which dates back to the fourteenth century. It is called the Church House. It was once a school and an almshouse, and is now old peoples flats and a studio.
